subroutine generate_perms(current, remaining, perms, count)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: current, remaining

   character(len=*), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: perms

   integer, intent(inout) :: count

   ! base case: if remaining is length 1

      perms(count) = current // remaining

      count = count + 1

   else

      do i = 1, len_trim(remaining)

         call generate_perms(current // remaining(i:i), remaining(1:i-1) //

subroutine generate_perms(current, remaining, perms, count)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: current, remaining

   character(len=*), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: perms

   integer, intent(inout) :: count

   ! base case: if remaining is length 1

      count = count + 1

      do i = 1, len_trim(remaining)

         call generate_perms(current // remaining(i:i), remaining(1:i-1) // remaining(i+1:), perms, count)

      end do

   end if

Another approach to generate permutations in lex order is to use the next permutation algorithm.

Start with the initial string, then generate each next permutation in order until all are generated.

The next permutation algorithm can be implemented in Fortran.

The steps for generating permutations in lex order using next permutation:

1. Start with the initial string (sorted in ascending order).

2. Generate the next permutation in lex order until no more permutations can be generated.

This approach is iterative and might be easier to implement in Fortran.

The algorithm for next permutation is as follows (from Wikipedia):

To find the next permutation in lex order:

1. Find the largest index k such that a[k] < a[k+1]. If no such index exists, the permutation is the last permutation.

2. Find the largest index l greater than k such that a[k] < a[l].

3. Swap a[k] and a[l].

4. Reverse the sequence from a[k+1] up to and including the final element.

   ! Step 2: find largest l >k with current(k) < current(l)

   l = n

   ! Step 3: swap k and l

   current(l:l) = temp

   ! Step 4: reverse from k+1 to end

   current(k+1:) = reverse(current(k+1:))

   ! Store the new permutation

   count = count +1

   perms(count) = current

end do

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, fact, count, i, k, l, start, end_pos, index1, index2, diff

   character(len=100) :: line1, line2, s1, s2

   character(len=10) :: current

   character(len=10), dimension(:), allocatable :: perms

   character(len=1) :: temp

   ! Read input

   read(*,*) n

   read(*, '(a)') line1

   read(*, '(a)') line2

   ! Process line1 to s1

   s1 = ''

   do i = 1, len_trim(line1)

      if (line1(i:i) /= ' ') then

         s1 = trim(s1) // line1(i:i)

      end if

   end do

   ! Process line2 to s2

   s2 = ''

   do i = 1, len_trim(line2)

      if (line2(i:i) /= ' ') then

         s2 = trim(s2) // line2(i:i)

      end if

   end do

   ! Generate permutations

   fact = factorial(n)

   allocate(perms(fact))

   ! Initialize current as "123...n"

   current = ''

   do i = 1, n

      write(current(i:i), '(i1)') i

   end do

   perms(1) = current

   count = 1

   do while (count < fact)

      ! Find k

      k = -1

      do i = n-1, 1, -1

         if (current(i:i) < current(i+1:i+1)) then

            k = i

            exit

         end if

      end do

      if (k == -1) exit

      ! Find l

      l = n

      do while (current(l:l) <= current(k:k))

         l = l -1

      end do

      ! Swap k and l

      temp = current(k:k)

      current(k:k) = current(l:l)

      current(l:l) = temp

      ! Reverse from k+1 to end

      start = k +1

      end_pos = n

      do while (start < end_pos)

         temp = current(start:start)

         current(start:start) = current(end_pos:end_pos)

         current(end_pos:end_pos) = temp

         start = start +1

         end_pos = end_pos -1

      end do

      ! Store current

      count = count +1

      perms(count) = current

   end do

   ! Find indices of s1 and s2

   index1 = 0

   index2 = 0

   do i = 1, count

      if (perms(i) == s1) then

         index1 = i

      end if

      if (perms(i) == s2) then

         index2 = i

      end if

   end do

   ! Compute difference

   diff = abs(index1 - index2)

   ! Convert to string

   character(len=10) :: diff_str

   write(diff_str, '(i0)') diff

   ! Get first character

   character(len=1) :: c = diff_str(1:1)

   integer :: ascii = ichar(c)

   ascii = ascii +1

   character(len=1) :: result_char = char(ascii)

   print '(a)', result_char

contains

   integer function factorial(n)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      integer :: i, res = 1

      do i = 1, n

         res = res * i

      end do

      factorial = res

   end function factorial

end program main
